title: 106_s2248
content:
The "Colusa Basin Watershed Integrated Resources Management Act" defines terms like District, Secretary, and State statute, and authorizes assistance. The Secretary is authorized to provide financial assistance to the District for planning, design, and construction in the Colusa Basin Watershed to reduce flood risks, assist in groundwater recharge, and preserve wetland habitat. Additionally, the assistance can be used to capture surface water for conservation and increased water supplies. SEC. 4. PROJECT SELECTION.

Eligible projects must be identified in the "Colusa Basin Water Management Program" document from February 1995 and comply with all relevant environmental requirements. The Secretary must ensure project compatibility with watershed protection efforts under existing laws.

SEC. 5. COST SHARING. The Secretary requires the District and cooperating non-Federal agencies to pay a percentage of construction costs and all operation, maintenance, and replacement costs for projects under this Act. Funds can be used for planning, design, and compliance activities. Contributions such as land and rights-of-way are considered in this section. The District contributes land, rights-of-way, and necessary relocations as payment for project costs. SEC. 6. Amounts spent under this Act are nonreimbursable. SEC. 7. Funds can only be used if a binding agreement is made with the District or local agency. SEC. 8. Reimbursement is governed by the agreement. SEC. 8. REIMBURSEMENT. The Secretary will reimburse the District or local agency for project work done before receiving funds under this Act, equal to the estimated Federal share of the cost. SEC. 9. COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS. The Secretary may enter into cooperative agreements with the District to assist in carrying out the Act. The District can enter into contracts and receive reimbursements under these agreements. Activities and financial assistance provided under this Act are not considered supplemental benefits under the Reclamation Reform Act of 1982. Authorization of appropriations is also included. Authorization of appropriations up to $25,000,000, with additional funds if needed for project costs, is granted to the Secretary to implement the Act.
